definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: This was the same mourning suit which he had made her put on when shehad quitted the Thenardiers' inn.
sentences.chinese: 那还是在她离开德纳第客店时他替她穿上的那身丧服。

sentences.english: This mourning was noticed in the town, and commented on.
sentences.chinese: 城里的人都注意到他的丧服，议论纷纷。

sentences.english: As he wished always to appear in mourning, he clothed himself with the night.
sentences.chinese: 他要永远居丧，只好以夜色为丧服。

sentences.english: Mr Toots was dressed in mourning.
sentences.chinese: 图茨先生是穿着丧服的。

sentences.english: After her husband died, she dressed in deep black for the rest of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫去世后，她终生都穿着黑色丧服。

sentences.english: The sisters stood in garments of mourning over the biers of their dead brothers.
sentences.chinese: 姐妹们身着丧服站在死去兄弟们的棺柩旁。

sentences.english: He awakened and dressed again in black and returned to the parlor.
sentences.chinese: 他醒来，穿上丧服，回到殡仪馆。

sentences.english: The street was empty apart from a women in widow's weeds.
sentences.chinese: 除了一位身着寡妇丧服的妇女外，街上空荡荡的。

sentences.english: In Iran, blue is the color of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 在伊朗，蓝色是丧服的颜色。

sentences.english: In South Africa, red is the color of mourning.
sentences.chinese: 在南非，红色是丧服的颜色。

definition: to wear mourning garb/to be in mourning
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
to keep watch beside a coffin/to observe a period of mourning
to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
